intro: Tetranthera obscura, commonly known as the dark tetranthera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, branching stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. Its leaves are usually narrow and opposite, and it produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in heads. Tetranthera obscura is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in humid, tropical environments.
